contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Yūsui |JapaneseName= 湧水町 |settlement_type= Town |MapImage= Yusui in Kagoshima Prefecture.png |Region= [[Kyūshū]] |Prefecture= [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]] |District= [[Aira District, Kagoshima|Aira]] |Area_km2= 144.33 |PopDate= July 1, 2005 |Population= 12,220 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 31 |LatitudeMinutes= 57 |LatitudeSeconds= 43 |LongtitudeDegrees= 130 |LongtitudeMinutes= 44 |LongtitudeSeconds= 10 |Tree= |Flower= |Bird= |SymbolImage= Flag of Yusui Kagoshima.JPG |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= |CityHallLink= [http://www.town.yusui.kagoshima.jp/ Town of Yūsui] }} [[Image:Yusui yoshimatsu.jpg|thumb|Yokomatsu city hall (former office for the village of Yokomatsu).]] {{nihongo|'''Yūsui'''|湧水町|Yūsui-chō}} is a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Aira District, Kagoshima|Aira District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. As of September 1, 2011, the town has an estimated [[population]] of 11,420 and the [[population density|density]] of 79.1 persons per km². The total area is 144.33 km². The town was founded on March 22, 2005 from the merger of the towns of [[Kurino, Kagoshima|Kurino]] and [[Yoshimatsu, Kagoshima|Yoshimatsu]], both from [[Aira District, Kagoshima|Aira District]]. "Yūsui" literally means "spring water", referring springs in the town. ==External links== {{Commons category-inline|Yusui, Kagoshima|Yūsui, Kagoshima}} *[http://www.town.yusui.kagoshima.jp/ Yūsui official website] {{ja icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yusui, Kagoshima}} [[Category:Towns in Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
